extendedInfo.description: This is an alpha version of the app,  a work in progress. We're aware of step counting problems on select  Motorola devices, we're looking into it. Please help us to make the app better by submitting your bug reports directly to support@fitrocket.comFitRocket helps you to lead a more active and healthier lifestyle. It's a power-saving pedometer that runs in the background on your Android phone. It tracks your activity level in real time, all the time, There's no need to spend $100+ on a separate hardware pedometer or activity tracker like a FitBit, Nike FuelBand, or Jawbone Up.FitRocket let you compete with your friends in real-time. Unlike FitBit, Nike FuelBand or Jawbone Up, you don't have to sync manually via USB or set up Bluetooth pairing. It syncs your data to our server automatically.  Your step counts and your friends step counts are always up to date.  Check out your competition anytime and message each other to stay motivated. Looking for ways to lose a few pounds?  Not only you need to maintain a healthy and balanced diet, you also need to exercise regularly, activities such as walking, running, hiking, and swimming. FitRocket helps you to develop active daily routines and achieve your weight loss goal.*** Features ***- Intelligent step counting algorithm that works for walking, hiking and running. - Power saving pedometer that runs in the background- Sync data automatically- Compete with friends, view real-time and historical stats, send messages from the app- Daily log: step counts, distance, and calories.- Personal settings: metric/imperial, stride length, height, body weight, daily goal, etc.FitRocket is available on Android phones running Ice Cream Sandwich and Jelly Bean. Our goal is to make it the best activity tracker, we welcome your feedback and suggestions at feedback@fitrocket.com

reviews.comment: Really like this app..works just like it should.  Very easy to use.
reviews.author: Terri McFarland

reviews.title: FitRocket has me walking...
reviews.comment: This is a great app... works off-line or on-line. I leave it on constantly and it\'s amazing. I check it for accuracy, and find that it\'s 95% accurate.  That\'s not bad at all...  I would love to see more functionality, though. it would be great if the information can be uploaded to FB or something else. more graphs would be cool too... For example, having a line graph that compares days. Also, maybe having a field where one can enter weight, so that we can track.   These suggested functionality would make the app, wicked cool, but as is, it is a great app.  I highly recommend it.
reviews.author: Edward Gonzalez

reviews.title: Chance it could be good
reviews.comment: Hey, it\'s in alpha... What do you expect, all you bashers?! Sure, it\'s unstable; but, so is my 2yo toddler when she runs. This app might be good, give it a chance.
reviews.author: Doug Eberle

reviews.title: Does not work.
reviews.comment: Does not record strides on a Motorola RAZR maxx.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Rubbish
reviews.comment: Don\'t bother, installed & constantly crashing my galaxy s2,imperial & metric settings are back to front, un installed &  returning to noom walk.
reviews.author: Andrew Whelan

reviews.title: A great pedometer
reviews.comment: No need to manually start and stop.  Runs in the background.  Pretty easy on battery too.
reviews.author: Tammy Doherty

reviews.title: Leity
reviews.comment: Loaded and worked ok then totally inaccurate a week later.  Uninstalled it as wouldn\'t run. Reinstalled but wouldn\'t run. Have Uninstalled again.  What a shame.
reviews.author: Irene Leitner

reviews.title: Cannot answer my phone!!
reviews.comment: Ok..app works fine. BUT..my phone rings and I cannot answer coz I don\'t see the answer/decline option!!!!! So uninstalled and everything is fine now. Please fix and would luv to download it. Btw..I am on HTC one x
reviews.author: Chaitra Shivni

reviews.title: It stopped counting!
reviews.comment: This was a great app for about 2 weeks until it stopped counting. I walked about three miles the other day and when I got home, I looked at my phone to see that I had only taken about 300 steps. Its been sketchy ever since. I uninstalled this app
reviews.author: A Google User
